title: Helping bronze players improve.

embed.description: This is part of a series, where I try and help others go from Bronze to silver. Heck maybe even gold. Im not the one playing, Im spectating a game. If you are bronze and want some help, let me know.

body:
Im not a professional when it comes to giving spontaneous advice, but what do you think this guy could have done in this game?
I should mention that hes new to league with like 200 norm wins.

replies.body:
It's actually not the formatting at all, so don't worry about what Nitro Is Senpai said. If you try to format the video to 16:9, you'll cut heaps off the top, and it'll look worse.

The actual solution to this is this:

1. Go into a custom game, and hit escape to bring up options.

2. Make sure you're on borderless, not windowed or fullscreen.

3. Click on the resolution drop down menu, and look for the resolution with the * symbol.

 That's your screen's maximum resolution or **native resolution**. Mine is 1280x1024 because I have a square screen as well. It's not 3:4 but very similar.

4. Find a resolution that keeps the the first number the same, but the second one changes. 

 e.g for me, my native resolution was **1280**x1024 so I picked **1280**x720.

5. There may be several resolutions with your first number at the front. So try them all out.

 You're looking for one that's 16:9, which is standard resolution for most YouTube videos.
6. Now run Fraps or OBS, to test some recording. 

 Make sure OBS is set to record the League of Legends window, NOT the whole screen. Otherwise you're going to get some of your desktop in the recording.

I hope this helped.

I know nothing about Gnar BTW, CSing looked OK though :D

Hi man, I'll be honest with you. I watched about 35 seconds of the movie then closed it - you need to format your youtube videos to the correct resolution, those black bars down the side watching it in 3:4 ratio is hideous.

Cheers though, please see this as constructive criticism.

Yeah Im still trying to learn how to get the right ratio.
After effects can be weird, But hay im sorry that having something in 1080 P with about 30-60 fps wasn't good enough.

And I dont see why the black bars on the side can be an issue? Almost every vid that was pre 2000 had it.
But meh, I need to figure out why after effects does that.
Soooo depressed to watch even for a Sliver scrub like me
